properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 5:23PM CST until January 10 at 8:15PM CST by NWS Fort Worth TX
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a

* Flood Advisory for Minor Flooding in Poor Drainage Areas for...
Parker County in north central Texas...

* Until 815 PM CST.

* At 519 PM CST, Doppler radar and rain gauges indicated
thunderstorms continued to produce heavy rainfall across portions
of Parker County. Radar estimates exceed 3 inches in the Walnut
Creek watershed near Springtown. In addition, street flooding has
been reported in the Weatherford area. Excessive runoff from
today's rainfall will continue to cause minor flooding,
particularly north Weatherford. This includes Willow Creek,
Gourdneck Creek, and Strickland Branch. Areas that are low-lying
or usually experience poor drainage are most likely to experience
flooding. This means some low water crossings may become
impassable.
properties.instruction:
When encountering flooded roads, turn around, don't drown. Most
flood deaths occur in vehicles.
